p: Groups of adult C. nubeculosus (1–7 days old), C. sonorensis (1–11 days old), Cx. p. pipiens (4–20 days old), and Ae. aegypti (4–7 days old) were transferred to plastic buckets (diameter: 12.2 cm, height: 12.2 cm; Jokey) and closed with netting before being taken to the BSL3 facility. Culex p. pipiens mosquitoes were kept on water for 3 days, whereas the other species were maintained on 6% glucose solution until being offered an infectious blood meal. SHUV P3 stock with a mean titer of 3.0 x 10 6 TCID 50/ml was mixed 1:1 with cow blood. The used cow blood was tested negative for Schmallenberg virus (SBV) antibodies, to prevent cross-neutralisation with SHUV. The infectious blood meal was provided through a Parafilm M membrane using the Hemotek PS5 feeding system, under dark conditions at 24°C and 70% relative humidity.
